title: Ticket #2628: TCP_FORWARDING_HOST and reconfig leaves stale entries in Collector
description:
Have a startd advertising itself with a private address, 

$ condor_status -format "%s, " Name -format "%s\n" MyAddress
localhost.localdomain, <10.72.55.105:9619>

Change its TCP_FORWARDING_HOST and reconfig, 

$ echo "TCP_FORWARDING_HOST = 174.129.47.20" > /etc/condor/config.d/40TCP_FORWARDING_HOST.config
$ condor_reconfig

The startd will re-advertise with the new IP, 

$ condor_status -format "%s, " Name -format "%s\n" MyAddress
localhost.localdomain, <10.72.55.105:9619>
localhost.localdomain, <174.129.47.20:9619?noUDP>

But the original advertisement is not cleaned up first. It will continue to be matched and fail, until it expires.

A restart of the startd will clear the old entry before adding the new.

A restart should not be necessary.
